headerDisplay: The UniFi Protect platform plugin for Homebridge exposes all of your UniFi Protect cameras to HomeKit as separate accessories. Each camera needs to be manually paired. 1. Open the Home app on your device. 2. Tap the Home tab, then tap . 3. Tap *Add Accessory*, and select *I Don't Have a Code or Cannot Scan*. 4. Enter the Homebridge PIN, this can be found under the QR code in Homebridge UI or your Homebridge logs, alternatively you can select *Use Camera* and scan the QR code again. For help and examples of common configurations please read the [Homebridge FFmpeg Plugin wiki](https://github.com/KhaosT/homebridge-camera-ffmpeg/wiki).
footerDisplay:
The **ffmpeg** binary must be installed on your system for this plugin to work.
For additional help please see the [developer page](https://github.com/hjdhjd/homebridge-unifi-protect2).

name.title: Platform Name
name.description: Name you want to assign to the UniFi Protect platform plugin.

videoProcessor.title: Video Processor
videoProcessor.description: Location of ffmpeg or your preferred video processor.

debugProtect.title: Debug Logging
debugProtect.description: Enable additional debug logging for this plugin.

controllers.title: Controllers
controllers.description: UniFi Protect controllers in your environment.

items.title: UniFi Protect Controller
items.description: Provide the details of your UniFi Protect controller.

url.title: URL
url.description:
For CloudKey Gen2+ include the port in the URL: https://my-cloud-key:7443.
For UnifiOS devices (UDM-Pro, UniFi NVR), exclude the port: https://my-udm-pro.

username.title: Username
username.description:
UniFi Protect username.
For UnifiOS devices (UDM-Pro, UniFi NVR) you can use your Ubiquiti account credentials.
2FA accounts are not supported at this time.
Creating a homebridge-specific local user is strongly encouraged for security and sanity.

password.title: Password
password.description:
UniFi Protect password.
For UnifiOS devices (UDM-Pro, UniFi NVR) you can use your Ubiquiti account credentials.
2FA accounts are not supported at this time.
Creating a homebridge-specific local user is strongly encouraged for security and sanity.

sourcePrefix.title: Source Prefix
sourcePrefix.description: Prefix to apply to the ffmpeg source command.

additionalCommandline.title: Additional Rendering Command Line Parameters
additionalCommandline.description: Additional parameters to pass to ffmpeg (or other videeo renderer).

mapaudio.title: Audio Channel Mapping
mapaudio.description: The mapping of audio channels in the RTSP stream from UniFi Protect to ffmpeg.

mapvideo.title: Video Channel Mapping
mapvideo.description: The mapping of video channels in the RTSP stream from UniFi Protect to ffmpeg.

maxStreams.title: Maximum Number of Streams
maxStreams.description: The maximum number of simultaneous streams permitted for a camera.

maxWidth.title: Maximum Image Width
maxWidth.description: The maximum image width reported to HomeKit.

maxHeight.title: Maximum Image Height
maxHeight.description: The maximum image height reported to HomeKit.

maxFPS.title: Maximum Framerate
maxFPS.description: The maximum video framerate reported to HomeKit.

packetSize.title: Packet Size
packetSize.description: The packet size to be used. If video or audio is choppy, try different values. This must be in increments of 188.

audio.title: Enable Audio
audio.description: Enable audio as well as video support. Warning: this requires ffmpeg to be compiled with fdk-aac which is not typically included by default in most installations of ffmpeg.
